conclusion: Analyze how liquids from points A, B, C, and D would flow through the baffle system to determine whether they'd end up in container E or F.
Colored sticks on the board represent baffles that redirect the flow of liquid as it moves downward.
Liquid starts falling from point A.
The first baffle encountered from point A is the teal/mint diagonal line sloping downward to the right.
Following the teal/mint baffle, the liquid from point A would be directed toward the right side.
Looking further down, there are more baffles that would continue redirecting the flow from point A.
Ultimately, based on the angled baffles, liquid from point A appears to be directed toward container F.
Liquid starts falling from point B.
As liquid falls from point B, it hits the yellow baffle that slopes downward to the left.
The yellow baffle directs the flow from point B leftward.
Continuing down, additional baffles would further direct the flow from point B.
The path from point B appears to lead toward container E.
Liquid falls from point C.
Liquid from point C encounters the blue diagonal baffle sloping downward to the left.
The blue baffle directs the liquid from point C toward the left side.
Following the path through subsequent baffles from point C.
Flow from point C appears to end up at container E.
Liquid falls from point D.
Liquid from point D hits the green baffle sloping downward to the left.
The green baffle directs the flow from point D leftward.
Following through the remaining baffles from point D.
Liquid from point D appears to end up at container E.
Liquids from the left side (A) get directed rightward.
Liquids from the right side (B, C, D) get directed leftward.
